کیپلر-22 بی پہلا ممکنہ طور پر قابل رہائش: What is the first potentially habitable exoplanet? Kepler-22b habitable exoplanet
Scientists confirmed the find, called TOI 700 d, using NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope and have modeled the planet's potential environments to help inform future observations.
What is the first potentially habitable exoplanet? Kepler-22b habitable exoplanet

Kepler-22b (also known by its Kepler Object of Interest designation KOI-087.01) is an exoplanet orbiting within the habitable zone of the Sun-like star Kepler-22. It is located about 640 light-years (200 parsecs) from Earth in the constellation of Cygnus.
کیپلر-22 بی سال 2010 میں دریافت ہوا تھا: When was Kepler-22b discovered? Kepler-22b discovery year
Discovery and observation Confirmation of the existence of Kepler-22b was announced on 5 December 2011.
When was Kepler-22b discovered? Kepler-22b discovery year

The discovery of Kepler-22b, an exoplanet orbiting Kepler-22 (otherwise known as UCAC3 276-148830, a sun-like G5 star about 600 light years from Earth) within the "habitable zone," the region where liquid water could exist on a planet's surface, was confirmed on December 5, 2011.
